title: FDA Approves First CRISPR Gene Therapy for Sickle Cell Disease
summary: Casgevy becomes the first FDA-approved treatment utilizing CRISPR/Cas9 gene-editing technology, marking a historic milestone in medicine.
content: The US Food and Drug Administration has approved Casgevy (exagamglogene autotemcel), a cell-based gene therapy for the treatment of sickle cell disease in patients 12 years and older.
